TextView.android:text:
Compile Project: 

Use the build menu to build the project.
You can setup all of your build configurations there.
You can choose to build the whole project.
You can choose to build just a modules.
Build your code.
Check for any errors in your build.
Fix all the errors in your code.
After fixing the errors, rebuild your code.
Check for errors again.
Repeat.
After all of your code checks out start testing.
To test your app install a phone emulator.
Check your available options for a phone emulator.
Once you find one, install it.
Make sure the emulator runs properly.
If everything is good run your code.
To run your code use the run menu.
From the run menu you can execute your code.
After running your code, check all the changes.
You should see the output of the code you wrote.
Test all of the application.
If the application doesn't run right, stop the code.
Fix any logic problems you have in your code.
Fix all other errors.
Once you have fixed your code, build all the code again.
If the build produces errors, fix the errors.
If the build is successful, rerun your code.
Test all of the application again.
If all of the code works right, deploy your code.
Deploy your code by copying the output binaries.
